content.full_text: Railroad Pass for Abraham Lincoln, 31 December 18571 NOT TRANSFERABLE2 This Ticket will pass but one person.3 PassHon A Lincoln Attorney forCompany4 Until Dec.[December] 31, 1858,unless otherwi[s]e ordered.
paragraphs: Railroad Pass for Abraham Lincoln, 31 December 18571
This Ticket will pass but one person.3
citations:
Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 49-54; For Lincoln’s cases
                     involving the Illinois Central Railroad, search Participant, “Illinois Central RR,”
                     Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis, et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org.

footnotes.text:
1James C. Clarke filled in the blanks on this partially printed railroad pass and signed
                  it. The pass bears ten punched holes, presumably made on presentation of the pass
                  to a railroad official for use.
2This text is printed vertically on the left side of the pass.
3This text is printed vertically on the right side of the pass.

4Lincoln had been  an attorney for the Illinois Central Railroad Company since 1853.Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 49-54; For Lincoln’s cases
                     involving the Illinois Central Railroad, search Participant, “Illinois Central RR,”
                     Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis, et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org.
5No correspondence related to this railroad pass has been located.

structured_content.text: Railroad Pass for Abraham Lincoln, 31 December 18571
This Ticket will pass but one person.3
